import styles from "./DoubtsPage.module.css"; import {useState} from 'react'; const DoubtsPage = () => { const [doubts, setDoubts] = useState([{id: 1, sender:"Dumas", title:"Doubt", body:"Hello world"},{id: 2, sender:"Dumas", title:"Doubt", body:"Hello world"}]); cons const goToDoubtPage = () => { // Implement this later window.location.href = "/"; }; const displayProfile = () => {}; // Gets all the profile info displayed const displayRooms = () => {}; // Gets all the rooms of a user displayed const displayRightSideBar = () => {}; const addDoubt = (doubtobj) => { // Adds a new doubt to the inner HTML through useState doubts. Takes an object // Should I ensure uniqueness of id of doubts? let x = [doubtobj]; for (let i = 0; i < doubts.length; i++) { x.push(doubts[i]); } setDoubts(x); }; const loadDoubt = () => { // Takes a number x and loads x more doubts }; const refreshDoubts = () => {}; // to be triggered when a WebSockets request is loaded return (
Querious
Current Room
User Name
Unread solutions: (0)
Rooms
Sender Name
Date, Time
This is just a sample doubt with some main question. I just wanted the question in two lines.

This is some random text which will serve as the place holder for the question description. Forgive my rambling but I have to do this in order to occupy some space in the question bubble. Now, let us see how this can be made responsive.

{doubts.map((item) => (
{item.sender}
Date, Time
{item.title}

{item.body}

))}

); }; export default DoubtsPage;
